name: Mercury
info: Although Mercury is much closer to the Sun than Earth, its minimum and maximum distances from the Sun (46-70 million kms) fluctuate much more than Earth does (24 million km compared to 5 million km).

name: Venus
info: While Venus is relatively close to Earth, don't plan a vacation there. The atmospheric pressure on Venus' surface is equivalent to being 1 kilometer under the ocean surface on Earth.

name: Mars
info: The closest Mars gets to Earth is approximately 55 million kilometers. Traveling at a constant speed of 100 km/H, it would take you nearly 63 years to reach Mars.

name: Jupiter
info: Jupiter's radius is over 11x larger than Earth's. A person who is 6 feet tall on Earth scaled up to the same ratio would be over 67 feet tall on Jupiter.

name: Saturn
info: While Saturn's circumference is nearly 9.5x larger than Earth's, it takes Saturn only 10 hours 39 minutes to rotate. For every day on Earth, there are 2.25 days on Saturn.

name: Uranus
info: F5 tornadoes, the strongest scale of tornadoes, can reach speeds of 420-511 km/h. That might feel calm compared to Uranus, where wind speeds can reach 900 km/h.

name: Neptune
info: Neptune takes nearly 165 years to orbit the sun. In their lifetime, most humans barely make it to their half Neptune-birthday.
